Photo of the Day

Winter wonderland with fresh powder #gnar

item.title: Arkansas River Levee Work Expected to Resume in February
item.description:
Arkansas River Levee Work Expected to Resume in February

The Pueblo Conservancy District is moving forward to find a contractor for the next phase of work to repair the Arkansas River Levee. Contractors will need to remove 12 feet of dirt and concrete from the top of the existing levee.

item.title: Sustainable Beginnings for the Steel City - PULP
item.description:
Sustainable Beginnings for the Steel City - PULP

Five years ago, as sustainability was emerging as a trend in the marketplace, professors at Colorado State University-Pueblo were looking at ways to integrate it into the curriculum. Their efforts resulted in a minor program in sustainability and today, professors say students are getting hired.

item.title: Jumpstarting Pueblo's recycling effort - PULP
item.description:
Jumpstarting Pueblo's recycling effort - PULP

While recycling activism is on an upward trend nationwide, it is proving to be a difficult task to implement recycling services locally and gain community involvement even though the majority of Pueblo residents support the movement.

item.title: A College Degree, Funded by Pot - PULP
item.description:
A College Degree, Funded by Pot - PULP

College-bound students in Pueblo will be able to benefit from taxes on legal marijuana grow operations starting in 2017. In November, Pueblo voters approved an excise tax on marijuana cultivators to fund college scholarships and various other community projects by a 60 to 40 percent margin.

item.title: Colorado's Frontrange from Space
item.description:
Colorado's Frontrange from Space

Have you ever seen Colorado like this? "The Colorado front range at night - Fort Collins, Denver, Colorado Springs and Pueblo shining bright." From astronaut Kjell N. Lindgren onboard the International Space Station on December 5, 2015.

item.title: The economic promise of Pueblo chile - PULP
item.description:
The economic promise of Pueblo chile - PULP

Is that chile you're eating really a Pueblo chile? Pueblo County Economic Development Director Chris Markuson wants locals, and eventually consumers across the country, to ask that question as the Pueblo chile grows in popularity. The question will hopefully be the result to a three-year strategic plan to build the brand around the Pueblo chile.
